summary: Emoji (eh-MOH-jee) are small digital images or symbols used in online communication. They can show emotions, objects, or activities. The word comes from Japanese, meaning "picture character." Emoji were first created in Japan in the 1980s and 1990s for mobile devices. They gained worldwide popularity in the 2010s when they were added to Unicode, a computer text standard. Emoji are now a big part of online culture, with the "Face with Tears of Joy" emoji named Word of the Year in 2015.
title: Emoji
